content.question: The function <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is defined by <math alttext="g of x, equals, the fraction with numerator the absolute value of x minus 5, end absolute value, and denominator x minus 5, end fraction, times the natural log of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator x plus 5, and denominator x squared, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>ln</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. At what values of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> does the graph of <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> have a vertical asymptote?

choices.label: <math alttext="x equals negative 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> only

<math alttext="x equals negative 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="x equals 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="x equals negative 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> only

topic.text: 1.14: Connecting Infinite Limits and Vertical Asymptotes
